cz.cuni.mff.kocur.server

Class RequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle
      • org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle
        • org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
          • cz.cuni.mff.kocur.server.RequestHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationChangeListener, Controllable, org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Container, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Destroyable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Dumpable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle

    public class RequestHandler
extends org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
implements Controllable, ConfigurationChangeListener
    This class extends a AbstractHandler. It's main purpose is to parse incoming requests and pass them to the appropriate classes that should handle them. This class also handles requests that are meant for the server - big updates, taking in the interests etc.
    Author:
    kocur

    • Field Detail

      • cfg

        private static final FrameworkConfiguration cfg
        Instance of global configuration.

      • logger

        private final org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger
        logger registered in Logger class.

      • controllerManager

        private static ControllersManager controllerManager
        Bot manager instance. This class will redistribute messages to bots.

      • scheduled

        private boolean scheduled
        If true, then scheduledCommand is not null.

      • saveIncoming

        private boolean saveIncoming
        If true, then we are saving incoming JSON POST requests to data in working directory. Names are generated as BOTID_timestamp.data or timestamp.data in case of team_update. This can be used for example to analyze a session or for offline learning.

      • saveOutcoming

        private boolean saveOutcoming
        If true, saves outcoming JSON responses to working directory. The filename will be response_[name_of_request].data. Where name_of_request is name of the incoming request, as specified above.

      • scheduledCommand

        private Command scheduledCommand
        Scheduled command - if not null, then we should send it in next session

      • stepping

        private boolean stepping
        Will be set to true, if we are currently stepping. That means we want to take in only on update for each hero and then tell the game and framework to pause.

      • controllersToMakeStep

        private java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> controllersToMakeStep
        List of controllers, that should make one step, before ending the stepping functionality.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestHandler

        public RequestHandler()
        Constructor. Registers itself in ConsoleManager. Sets change listener. Initializes the handler.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the request handler. Will set booleans like saveIncoming, saveOutcoming etc.

      • makeResponse

        private void makeResponse(org.eclipse.jetty.server.Request baseRequest,
                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                          Response res)
        Makes response. This doesn't save outcoming so it should be called only on bad responses.
        Parameters:
        baseRequest - The request.
        response - The HttpServletResponse.
        res - Response to be sent out.
